newsitem.title: CAMBODIA: ILO steps up fight vs child labour in Cambodia.
newsitem.headline: ILO steps up fight vs child labour in Cambodia.

text.p: Cambodia has agreed to work with a U.N.-affiliated group to try to stop child labour from spreading in the impoverished country.
The government signed a memorandum of understanding with the International Labour Organisation (ILO) laying out areas of cooperation on Monday.
"With this memorandum of understanding we are encouraged that the government has committed itself to do something about the issue," said Catherine Comtet, head of the ILO's regional office.
Comtet signed the memorandum with Social, Labour and Veteran's Affairs Secretary of State Suy Sem. She said the ILO would both assist the ministry and help contain the problem.
"With the cooperation of the ILO, we will try step-by-step to eliminate child labour in Cambodia," Suy Sem told reporters.
A recently compiled ILO report found that more than 600,000 Cambodians under the age of 17, or 16 percent of children, were economically active, mostly in the agricultural sector.
Although this compared favourably with an average 20 percent for the whole of Asia, Comtet said the worry was that the level of child labour would increase along with economic growth.
